title:
(Twisted) canonical supermultiplets and their resolutions as open-closed
  homotopy algebras
abstract:
We argue that some supersymmetric multiplets can naturally be equipped with
the structure of an open-closed homotopy algebra. This structure is readily
described through the pure spinor superfield formalism, which in particular
associates a canonical multiplet for each choice of supersymmetry algebra. We
study the open-closed homotopy algebra associated to (twists of) (resolutions
of) the canonical multiplet, and show that it fits into a span of open-closed
homotopy algebras, extending results of Cederwall et al. arXiv:2304.01258.
